alert.note: Alert for Buffalo; Hand; Hughes; Hyde; Sully (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued February 21 at 1:58PM MST until February 23 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CST WEDNESDAY... ...BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM WEDNESDAY TO NOON CST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Blizzard Warning, blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of 9 to 12 inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. For the Winter Weather Advisory, mixed precipitation this afternoon into early this evening and blowing snow tonight. Additional snow accumulations of up to two inches and ice accumulations of a light glaze. Winds gusting as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...Sully, Hughes, Hyde, Hand and Buffalo Counties. * WHEN...For the Blizzard Warning, from 6 AM Wednesday to noon CST Thursday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 6 AM CST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions will impact the morning or evening commute. The dangerously cold wind chills as low as 35 below zero will cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
